title: New: Left Right Arms – A Sleep EP
content:
As much as you’d think that with the colossal amount of music I write about, or even listen to, that I might forgot 99% of it within a matter of days, I’m actually very much at the opposite end of the spectrum.

Japanese teenage bedroom sensation Left Right Arms first appeared back in September last year, and just this evening has released his debut EP, the refined A Sleep. Delicate and timid, there’s a stellar songwriting capability expressed, verging into pop territory (Twelve Oaks), not mention the sublime, singalong chorus of Ascend Soon.

For an artist with little to no online presence, no visible identity and only a handful of tracks to his name Left Right Arms makes one hell of an impact. Minimal yet intensely thought-provoking, it’s refreshing to hear a young artist that truly values substance over style. Check out the full EP below, and grab it at a pay-what-you-like deal.
